div.p: German music publishing house, founded in 1793 in Bonn, but moved to Berlin in 1870. Simrock published works by J. S. Bach (notably his Well-tempered Clavier (1800)), Haydn, Beethoven, Mendelssohn, Schumann, Dvořák, Bruch, and was the principal publisher of Brahms's music.

div.head: Simrock and Schenker
div.p: Simrock published Schenker's Ländler für Pianoforte, Op. 10 (1899).

Correspondence between Simrock and Heinrich Schenker survives as OJ 14/24 (1898-1900: 6 items), one letter to Jeanette Kornfeld (= Schenker) as OC B/258 (1913), and correspondence with Oswald Jonas as OJ 36/227 and 240 (1963).
